result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca M Bray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rebecca M Bray in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Rebecca M Bray in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 1, 2 and 5 DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN on COUNTS 3 and 4.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to the amended charges in COUNTS 3 and 4.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the amended information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.    

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, concurrent with COUNT 4.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 1 YEAR with the following conditions:
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation
-Pay all supervision fees; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment 
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-No contact with Famous Daves, Kathline G., Matthew B. and Cynthia P. 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or illegal drugs
-No use of prescription medications without a valid prescription 
-Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service 
-No weapons 

AS TO COUNT 4:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, concurrent with COUNT 3.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 1 YEAR with the following conditions:
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Court waived DNA sample and related surcharge as defendant is providing a sample and payment on COUNT 3 
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation
-Pay all supervision fees; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment 
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-No contact with Famous Daves, Kathline G., Matthew B. and Cynthia P. 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or illegal drugs
-No use of prescription medications without a valid prescription 
-No weapons 

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Defendant Rebecca M Bray in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Rebecca M Bray in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Amended Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of her client.  COUNTS 3, 4 and 5 are amended to Theft, pursuant to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 943.20(1)(a), Class A Misdemeanor.

Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Rebecca M Bray not in court, in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This matter was set for 1:30 p.m. this date.  Attorney had it calendared for 8:30 a.m.  Attorney unable to come back at 1:30 p.m.  This matter has been recalendared for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rebecca M Bray in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Rebecca M Bray in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense missing discovery.  Discussions held regarding the missing discovery.  Parties request an adjournment.  Court grants one last adjournment.  If matter does not resolve on the next Court date, matter will be set for Jury Trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Rebecca M Bray not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant in custody not produced, appearance waived.  Case calendared for status conference.  Court ordered case adjourned for soft projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rebecca M Bray in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Rebecca M Bray in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Defense request new counsel.   Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney Smtih is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 19.

Defendant Rebecca M Bray in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Rebecca M Bray in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  AS TO COUNTS 3, 4, AND 5:  Motion to dismiss FOR LACK OF PROBABLE CAUSE by the defense, argued and GRANTED by the Court. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
